bug.summary: [Layer Issue] Image Resampling - DownSampling2dLayer is KO
bug.description:
The layer tl.layers.DownSampling2dLayer is KO. import tensorflow as tf import tensorlayer as tl
tf.logging.set_verbosity(tf.logging.DEBUG) tl.logging.set_verbosity(tl.logging.DEBUG)
plh = tf.placeholder(tf.float16, [32, 16, 16, 3])
net_in = tl.layers.InputLayer(plh) print("INPUT SHAPE: %s" % str(net_in.outputs.shape))
net_up = tl.layers.UpSampling2dLayer(net_in, size=(2, 2), is_scale=True, method=0, align_corners=True) print("UPSAMPLING OUT SHAPE: %s" % str(net_up.outputs.shape))
try: net_down = tl.layers.DownSampling2dLayer(net_up, size=(0.5, 0.5), is_scale=True, method=0, align_corners=True) print("DOWNSAMPLING OUT SHAPE (float scale): %s" % str(net_down.outputs.shape))
except: net_down = tl.layers.DownSampling2dLayer(net_up, size=(2, 2), is_scale=True, method=0, align_corners=True) print("DOWNSAMPLING OUT SHAPE (int scale): %s" % str(net_down.outputs.shape)) Output: [TL] InputLayer input: (32, 16, 16, 3) INPUT SHAPE: (32, 16, 16, 3) [TL] UpSampling2dLayer upsample2d_layer: is_scale: True size: (2, 2) method: 0 align_corners: True UPSAMPLING OUT SHAPE: (32, 32, 32, 3) [TL] DownSampling2dLayer downsample2d_layer: is_scale: True size: (0.5, 0.5) method: 0, align_corners: True [TL] DownSampling2dLayer downsample2d_layer: is_scale: True size: (2, 2) method: 0, align_corners: True DOWNSAMPLING OUT SHAPE (int scale): (32, 64, 64, 3) # <= ERROR HERE, should be: (None, 16, 16, 3) Impossible to downscale with a float scale factor < 1 or an int scale factor > 1. Basically tl.layers.DownSampling2dLayer and tl.layers.UpSampling2dLayer are identical. I have fix this issue in PR #755, however this not merged yet. Btw, I'm quite surprised that there is no existing unittest for this layer. PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorlayer/tensorlayer/pull/796>#796</denchmark-link> updated this layer without fixing the bug...
